> I had problems running junit task and had to keep the junit jar
> (juni=
t3.8.1.jar) in ant lib folder  (ANT_HOME/lib) and use a 
> <classpath /> wi=
th all the ant lib jars added to it.
> 
> This works when I run the build s=
cript through ant from command line.
> The same build script will not work =
from within Eclipse. Not sure why.

It could be that when you're running an=
t from within Eclipse, you're not
using the ant you think you're using.  Th=
at's happened to me before.  By
default, Eclipse uses its own ant, which ha=
s its own ant/lib, which
doesn't come with the JUnit jars in it.  My soluti=
on was to configure
Eclipse to use the same ant I used from outside Eclipse=
.


Todd.
